
alpha = ['a','b','c','d','e','f','g','h','i','j','k','l','m','n','o','p','q','r','s','t','u','v','w','x','y','z']
k = input()
for n in range(k):
    z = raw_input()
    a = list(z)
    b = []
    for c in a:
        if c not in b:
            b.append(c)
    b.sort()
    def palindrome(string):
        z = 0
        for b in range(len(string)):
            z -= 1
            if string[b]==string[z]:
                flag = 0
            else:
                flag = 1
                break
        if flag == 0:
            return True
        else:
            return False
    if b == alpha and palindrome(z):
        print "palingram"
    else:
        if b == alpha:
            print "pangram"
        elif palindrome(z):
            print "palindrome"

        else:
            print "none"
